info.title: IIH Essentials API
info.description:
Description of the REST API of IIH Essentials.
The maximum size limit for a single request (no file) is 4 MB.
The connection timeout is 10 seconds.

get.summary: Get used disk space by adapters.
get.description: Return the size of the adapters folder.

Get a list of aggregations, aggregations can be filtered by variable ids. 

 Please note that the generated curl command and request URL should be modified, if using a filter, before using sending the request to IIH Essentials. The returned array for variableIds must be enclosed in (square) brackets [], each single string should be in quotation marks and strings should remain separated by commas, in case multiple strings are used for a filter. For instance: 

 - For a single variableId: http://localhost:4203/DataService/Aggregations?variableIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9"] 

 - For multiple variableIds: http://localhost:4203/DataService/Aggregations?variableIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9","eab960dcb97e4752b298387f780cba1e"]

parameters.name: variableIds
parameters.description: The variable ids have to be specified as JSON array

post.description:
Creates a new aggregation of an existing variable.
Cycle must be unique and only Second, Minute, Hour and Day are currently supported as base.
Allowed values for factor depend on base.
For 'Duration' and 'Occurrence' the aggregate options must be set.

Query alarms by filter.
Can be queried by ChannelId and/or AssetId (the combinded result of ChannelId and AssetId should not be empty), Area (using IN), Source (using IN), Origin (using IN), AlarmClass (using IN), IsActive(using IN), IsAcknowledged(using In), IsConfirmed(using IN), ExtendedProperties(each extendeProperty has name, and value(using In); if no value given, only filter by extendedProperty name), TimeStamp (using >=, <=), order by timestamp DESC or ASC, all query conditions are connected by AND.

get.description:
Get a list of Aspects. Aspects can be filtered by aspectId or assetId. If no filter is specified, all aspects will be returned. It is not supported to specify more than one filter parameter. 

 Please note that the generated curl command and request URL should be modified, if a filter is being used, before using sending the request to IIH Essentials. The returned array must be enclosed in (square) brackets [], each single string should be in quotation marks and strings should remain separated by commas, in case multiple strings are used for a filter. For instance: 

 - Filtering for a single assetId: http://localhost:4203/DataService/Aspects?assetIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9"] 

 - Filtering for multiple assetIds: http://localhost:4203/DataService/Aspects?assetIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9","eab960dcb97e4752b298387f780cba1e"]

Get a list of assets. Assets can be filtered by assetId. Breadcrumb and children can be added to the response if specific assets are requested. 

 Please note that the generated curl command and request URL should be modified, if a filter is being used, before using sending the request to IIH Essentials. The returned array must be enclosed in (square) brackets [], each single string should be in quotation marks and strings should remain separated by commas, in case multiple strings are used for a filter. For instance: 

 - Filtering for a single assetId: http://localhost:4203/AssetService/Assets?assetIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9"]&includeChildren=true&includeBreadcrumb=true 

 - Filtering for multiple assetIds: http://localhost:4203/AssetService/Assets?assetIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9","eab960dcb97e4752b298387f780cba1e"]&includeChildren=true&includeBreadcrumb=true

post.description: Calculate an aggregated value for several datasources. Currently all datasource types are handled as variables. Some aggregation are not supported for single value calculation (None, MinMaxTrend, Gantt, GanttView, StepDuration, ValueChanges). The response size is limited to 4 MB. In order to not exceed this limit, maximum 100 dataSources are supported per request. Furthermore, you should be cautions when choosing the time range and cycle time as these affect the size of the response, too.

get.description:
Get time series data of multiple variables. The response size is limited to 4 MB. In order to not exceed this limit, maximum 100 variables are supported per request. Furthermore, you should be cautions when choosing the time range and cycle time as these affect the size of the response, too. 

 Please note that the generated curl command and request URL should be modified before using sending the request to IIH Essentials. The returned array for variableIds must be enclosed in (square) brackets [], each single string should be in quotation marks and strings should remain separated by commas, in case multiple strings are used for a filter. For instance: 

 - For a single variableId: http://localhost:4203/DataService/Data?variableIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9"]&from=2024-04-17T09:00:00.000Z&to=2024-04-17T10:05:00.000Z 

 - For multiple variableIds: http://localhost:4203/DataService/Data?variableIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9","eab960dcb97e4752b298387f780cba1e"]&from=2024-04-17T09:00:00.000Z&to=2024-04-17T10:05:00.000Z

parameters.name: variableIds
parameters.description: The variableIds have to be specified as JSON array of strings.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Begin timestamp of the data query. A value stored with a timestamp exactly of 'from' is not included in the result.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End timestamp of the data query. A value with a timestamp exactly of 'to' is included in the result. Has to be greater than from.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify the maximum number of values to be returned for one variable. Must be between 2000 and zero. If not specified or outside of the boundaries, a default limit of 2000 is used. If there are more datapoints in the requested period than the specified limit, an additional object 'hasMoreData' is returned with the response. It provides information how to request the remaining datapoints. If one variable has reached the limit, the number of values of other variables could be reduced, too. The reason is that 'from' and 'to' are adapted to the first and last data point of the variable which has reached the limit, and 'from' and 'to' are always applied to all variables of the request.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify in which time order the values should be returned. If not specified the default value will be Ascending.

parameters.name: excludeBadQuality
parameters.description: Optional parameter to exclude values which have bad quality code.

LimitData.description: The data limit is set to 2. The first variable is limited by 2 values and a hasMoreData object is created. This limits the second variable, as all their values are after the from timestamp of the hasMoreData object.

post.summary: Get timeseries data of multiple variables.
post.description: Bulk version of single variable read. The response size is limited to 4 MB. In order to not exceed this limit, maximum 100 variables are supported per request. Furthermore, you should be cautions when choosing the time range and cycle time as these affect the size of the response, too.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Begin timestamp of the data query. A value stored with a timestamp exactly of 'from' is not included in the result. It can be overriden in the request body by giving a 'from' value to the specific variable.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End timestamp of the data query. A value with a timestamp exactly of 'to' is included in the result. Has to be greater than from. It can be overriden in the request body by giving a 'to' value to the specific variable.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify the maximum number of values to be returned for one variable. If not specified a default limit of 2000 is used. Has to be greater or equal than zero. It can be overriden in the request body by giving a 'limit' value to the specific variable.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify in which time order the values should be returned. If not specified the default value will be Ascending. It can be overriden in the request body by giving a 'order' value to the specific variable.

parameters.name: excludeBadQuality
parameters.description: Optional parameter to exclude values which have bad quality code.

LimitData.description: The data limit is set to 1 in parameters. First variable overrided it by 3 and a hasMoreData object specific to it is created. Order is set to Descending as default in query parameters. Only first variable overrided it with Ascending. The rest used the default Descending order. Default from and to values are specified in parameters but except the last variable, all variables have overriden the time range. All variables have their specific hasMoreData result in their response objects.

Get a list of Variables. Variables can be filtered by assetsIds, aspectIds, adapterIds or variableIds. If no filter is specified, all variables will be returned. It is not supported to specify more than one filter parameter. 

 Please note that the generated curl command and request URL should be modified, if a filter is being used, before using sending the request to IIH Essentials. The returned array must be enclosed in (square) brackets [], each single string should be in quotation marks and strings should remain separated by commas, in case multiple strings are used for a filter. For instance: 

 - Filtering for a single assetId: http://localhost:4203/DataService/Variables?assetIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9"] 

 - Filtering for multiple assetIds: http://localhost:4203/DataService/Variables?assetIds=["53f05e175c0c48bd9742157c1a462ca9","eab960dcb97e4752b298387f780cba1e"]

parameters.name: assetIds

parameters.name: aspectIds
parameters.description: Filter the variable list by aspectIds.

parameters.name: adapterIds
parameters.description: Filter the variable list by adapterIds.

parameters.description: Filter the variable list by variableIds.

post.description: Creates an aspect. All depending types must be known to the system. Attributes are always specific to the entity and can only be-reused in case of a constant behavior of the associated attribute type. Attributes can always consist of a value (in this case the value must match the attribute type's data type) and a attribute type definition. The latter is required for instance-specific attributes. If the complete attribute type definition is present, the system must check if the definition is identical to the already known one which might have come from the entity type.

requestBody.description: JSON document of the Aspect to be created. Missing $anchor-identifiers will automatically be created. `$concept` (if present) must be set to value `aspect`.

201.description: JSON document of the newly created aspect instance serialized according to schema `Entity`.

get.description: Returns all aspects.

parameters.name: namefilter
parameters.description: one or multiple filter statements. Default: `*`

parameters.name: typefilter
parameters.description: UUID of the AspectType the response has to match or be inherited from. Default: Empty, filter not active.

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: UUID of the anchor **after** which the result set shall start. Default: Empty, start with the first entry.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Maximum offset of entries with respect to the provided reference. Default: `0`

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries in the result. Default: `20`

parameters.name: selectors
parameters.description: one or multiple selector statements. Default: `+$anchor,+$attributes`

parameters.name: expanded
parameters.description: Sub entities within attributes shall be automatically expanded and serialized along. Default: `false`

200.description: JSON document with array of Aspect instances serialized according to schema `Entity`. `$concept` (if present) is always set to value `aspect`.

x-anchor-position.description: Position of the anchor provided as reference.

schema.description: Position of the anchor provided as reference.
Overall count of results.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the aspect.

parameters.name: selectors
parameters.description: one or multiple selector statements. Default: `+$anchor,+$attributes`

parameters.name: expanded
parameters.description: Sub aspects or aspects within attributes shall be automatically expanded and serialized along. Default: `false`

200.description: JSON document with the Aspect instance serialized according to schema `Entity`. `$concept` (if present) is always set to value `aspect`.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the aspect.

AttributeDynamicValue.description:
Dynamic value of an Attribute. Contained in the Attribute property $_dynamicValue.
This is the latest (newest) timeseries value.
`Use case` Show online values in the Attribute tab.

value.description: The dynamic value of an Attribute.

allOf.description: Extended qualitycode information of the value.
Expanded AttributeType object. Added only if the query parameter _includeExpandedType is true.
Specifies where the owning Entity is located in the IIH tree. Added only if the query parameter _includePath is true.

$_subEntities.description:
Details about Sub-Entities defined via composition or aggregation. Added only if the query parameter _includeSubEntities is true.
$_subEntities is always an array. For non-array attributes the array contains exactly one element.

$_owner.description: Anchor of the Entity the Attribute belongs to. In GET methods added only if the query parameter _includeOrigin is true. In POST and PATCH methods $_owner and $_origin is always present in the result.

$_origin.description: Anchor of the EntityType the Attribute is inherited from. Null in case of a instance specific Attribute. Added only if the query parameter _includeOrigin is true.

allOf.description:
Source configuration of the Attribute. Added only if the query parameter _includeSource is true.
This property indicates if there is timeseries data attached to the Attribute. If its null there is no timeseries data attached.
State info of the Attribute. Added only if the query parameter _includeState is true. Not available for static Attributes.
Dynamic value of the Attribute. Added only if the query parameter _includeDynamicValue is true. Not available for static Attributes.

AttributeSource.description:
Source configuration of an Attribute. Contained in the Attribute property $_source.
The fact that there is a source configuration indicates that there is timeseries data attached to the Attribute. If $_source is null there is no timeseries data attached to the Attribute.

sourceType.description:
The type of the source.
`none` No connection to an external source. Data can be stored via the REST API.
`tag` Direct connection to a single tag of a connector.
`rule` Formula configuration. Formula operands are connected to tags of a connector.

store.description: If false no connection to the source will be established.

allOf.description: Source details in case of sourceType tag. Not present if sourceType is not tag.
Source details in case of sourceType rule. Not present if sourceType is not rule.

AttributeSourceRule.description: Source configuration details of an attribute in case sourceType is rule.

formula.description:
The formula of the rule.
`Example` var1 + var2
For this example the tags array must contain one entry with the name var1 and one entry with the name var2.

tags.description: Array of tags to be assigned to formula operands.

AttributeSourceRuleTag.description: Source configuration details of an Attribute in case sourceType is rule.

adapterId.description: Id of the adapter (connector). This id is not an anchor.

connectionName.description: Name of the connection inside the namespace of the connector.

tagName.description: Name of the tag inside the namespace of the connector.

name.description: Name of the formula operand this tag is assigned to.

AttributeSourceTag.description: Source configuration details of an attribute in case sourceType is tag.

adapterId.description: Id of the adapter (connector). This id is not an anchor.

AttributeState.description:
State information of an attribute. Contained in the Attribute property $_state.
State colors:
`Green` connected is true and there are no errors.
`Yellow` connected is true and there are errors.
`Grey` connected is false and there are no errors. No connection by intent. Could be because store is false, the connector is deactivated, there is not source at all ect.
`Red` connected is false and there are errors.

AttributeStateError.description:
One erro inside the $_state objects error array.
In reality here a full Exception object will be returned. Here only the minimal subset of properties relevant for the frontend application is shown.

CalculateJobMode.description:
Enumeration to specify the mode of a calculate job.
    Single - A single value over the whole time range should be calculated.
    Trend - Multiple values within the time range should be calculated taking the calculationTimeRange into account.

to.description: timestamp to start calculation as ISO8601 string.

now.description: optional parameter to overide the current timestamp as ISO8601 string.

error.description: optional error description. If error is set, all values will be null.

Enumeration to specify the behaviour of getting a calculate job collection.

any unsigned 16-bit integer value. Optional for write calls, 192 will be used as a default.
Values will be interpreted according to set bits (Mask 0xC0):

0x40 => Quality Uncertain
0x80 => Quality Good non cascade
0xC0 => Quality Good (cascade)
